availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Rabb (Ohio County, Indiana, resident and soldier.)

body.p: Ohio County, Indiana, resident, printer, and soldier. Indiana native. Son of David G. Rabb and Margaret Rabb. Resident of Ohio County, Indiana, in 1850. Printer in Ohio County in 1860. Served in the 7th Indiana Regiment Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a captain from April 25, 1861 to August 1861. Served in the 2nd Battery Indiana Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a captain from October 10, 1862 to January 21, 1864. Served in the 2nd Missouri Light Artillery (U.S.A.) as a major from January 21, 1864, to August 25, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Indiana, Ohio County, District No. 2, p. 315A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Ohio County, Randolph Township, p. 446.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Missouri, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M405, Roll 0338.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. 2, 1861-1865 (Indianapolis: W.R. Holloway, State Printer, 1865), p. 10.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Indiana, vol. 3, 1861-1865 (Indianapolis: W.R. Holloway, State Printer, 1866), p. 387.
"John W. Rabb (1839-1867)," Find A Grave, Memorial #151074254, Accessed July 7, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/151074254.
